exploits.description: MongoDB 2.4.x before 2.4.5 and 2.5.x before 2.5.1 allows remote authenticated users to obtain internal system privileges by leveraging a username of __system in an arbitrary database.
MongoDB CVE-2017-15535 Memory Corruption Vulnerability
MongoDB libbson CVE-2017-14227 Heap Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
MongoDB CVE-2016-3104 Remote Denial of Service Vulnerability
mongodb-clients CVE-2016-6494 Local Information Disclosure Vulnerability
Mongodb CVE-2014-3971 Denial-Of-Service Vulnerability
MongoDB BSON Object Length Parsing Information Disclosure Vulnerability
MongoDB 'conn' Mongo Object Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
MongoDB Remote Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
MongoDB CVE-2013-2132 NULL Pointer Dereference Remote Denial of Service Vulnerability
MongoDB CVE-2013-1892 Remote Code Injection Vulnerability
MongoDB CVE-2013-4142 code execution
MongoDB privilege escalation
MongoDB engine_spidermonkey.cpp code execution
MongoDB nativeHelper.apply Remote Code Execution
MongoDB nativeHelper.apply Remote Code Execution
MongoDB Web Admin Detection
MongoDB Detection
MongoDB system.users Collection Permission Weakness Password Hash Disclosure
MongoDB V8 JavaScript Engine Unitialized conn Object Prototype Calling Arbitrary Code Execution
MongoDB Arbitrary Database __system Name Remote Privilege Escalation
MongoDB mongo-python-driver (pymongo) _cbsonmodule.c Null Pointer Dereference DoS
MongoDB Default Unpassworded Administrator Account
MongoDB Plaintext Data Local Disclosure
MongoDB engine_spidermonkey.cpp nativeHelper.apply Function Remote Code Execution
Wireshark MongoDB Dissector Infinite Loop Malformed Packet Parsing Remote DoS
